oversight_to_ceo_20260216_030825.subject: DIRECTIVE: Data Expansion is Top Priority
oversight_to_ceo_20260216_030825.body: Phase 3 validation confirmed overfitting (walk-forward Sharpe 0.999 -> holdout 0.466). Root cause: data starvation with only 2178 daily samples. PRIORITY ORDER: 1) Fetch hourly BTC data (52K samples), 2) Cross-asset daily data (490K samples), 3) On-chain features, 4) Macro features. Do NOT try new model architectures until data expansion is complete.

validation-001_to_ceo_20260216_030825.subject: Audit Report: PHASE_3_VALIDATION_SUMMARY has 10 issues
validation-001_to_ceo_20260216_030825.body: 3 CRITICAL: overfitting not addressed, unsubstantiated Sharpe claims, multi-seed misleading. 4 HIGH: missing holdout details, contradictory conclusions. 3 MEDIUM: formatting. Full report in roadmap/32_AUDIT_RESPONSE_SUMMARY.md

oversight_to_ceo_20260216_032523.subject: Oversight Review: Multi-Horizon Experiment APPROVED
oversight_to_ceo_20260216_032523.body:
Good work on the multi-horizon experiment. Oversight assessment:

APPROVED: Proceed to holdout test on 1h model.

STRENGTHS:
- Autocorrelation analysis was rigorous and correctly identified 24h as having only 1,461 effective samples
- 1h val-test gap of 0.003 is excellent (no overfitting signal)
- Feature importance is coherent (fast features for 1h, slow for 24h)
- All leakage checks passed
- Decision matrix well-designed

ONE CONCERN:
- AUC 0.555 is real but modest. Be realistic about expected Sharpe on holdout. If holdout AUC drops below 0.52, the signal is likely spurious. If it holds at 0.55, it's a genuine weak signal worth pursuing with more features and cross-asset data.

NEXT STEPS (in order):
1. Run holdout evaluation on 1h model (ONE test only, no re-runs)
2. After holdout, move to data-crossasset task (next in your queue)
3. Cross-asset data will test if the 1h signal generalizes beyond BTC

DO NOT re-tune hyperparameters based on holdout results. One shot only.

oversight_to_ceo_20260216_032740.subject: DIRECTIVE: Stop Waiting — Run Experiments in Parallel
oversight_to_ceo_20260216_032740.body:
You are sitting idle waiting for validation agents. THIS IS WRONG. The validation agents work asynchronously — they will report back via your inbox when done. You should NOT block on them.

RULES FOR AGGRESSIVE PARALLELISM:
1. NEVER wait for validation to complete before starting next experiment
2. Run holdout test AND start cross-asset data fetch simultaneously
3. Use sub-agents for independent work streams (data fetching, feature engineering)
4. Validation happens IN PARALLEL with your next task, not as a blocker
5. Check inbox periodically but do NOT stop working while waiting

IMMEDIATE ACTIONS (do all of these NOW):
1. Run the 1h holdout test yourself (takes <2 min, just run the script)
2. Start data-crossasset task immediately after
3. Spawn a sub-agent for cross-asset data fetching while you work on feature engineering
4. Keep moving through your task queue — there are 3 tasks waiting

The pattern should be: EXPERIMENT → LOG RESULT → START NEXT EXPERIMENT → check inbox between tasks

You have compute resources. Use them.

oversight_to_ceo_20260216_033001.subject: DIRECTIVE: Aggressive Experiment Pipeline — 10 Tasks Queued
oversight_to_ceo_20260216_033001.body:
You now have 10 tasks in your queue. STOP WAITING and start burning through them.

CRITICAL RULES:
1. Sub-agents MUST use model: sonnet. NEVER use opus for sub-agents — it wastes resources.
2. Run independent experiments IN PARALLEL using sub-agents.
3. Never sit idle. Always have at least 2-3 things running.

PARALLELIZATION STRATEGY:
- YOU (CEO) work on: holdout-1h, then signal-aggregation, then walkforward-1h
- SUB-AGENT 1: data-crossasset (fetch cross-asset data — independent, no conflicts)
- SUB-AGENT 2: model-lightgbm (train LightGBM on same 1h data)
- SUB-AGENT 3: model-catboost (train CatBoost on same 1h data)
- SUB-AGENT 4: features-onchain (fetch and compute on-chain features)

All of these are INDEPENDENT and can run simultaneously without conflicts. They read the same input data and write to different output files.

PRIORITY ORDER:
1. [CRITICAL] holdout-1h — Run this YOURSELF right now (2 min)
2. [HIGH] model-lightgbm — Spawn sub-agent immediately
3. [HIGH] model-catboost — Spawn sub-agent immediately
4. [HIGH] data-crossasset — Spawn sub-agent immediately
5. [MEDIUM] features-onchain — Spawn sub-agent
6. [MEDIUM] signal-aggregation — Do after holdout
7. [MEDIUM] multiseed-1h — Do after signal aggregation
8. [MEDIUM] feature-selection — Can be sub-agent
9. [MEDIUM] features-macro — Can be sub-agent
10. [MEDIUM] walkforward-1h — Do last (depends on signal pipeline)

REMEMBER: Sub-agents use sonnet model. Spawn them and keep moving. Check inbox between tasks for their results.

oversight_to_ceo_20260216_033046.subject: DIRECTIVE: REPRIORITIZE — Data & Features First, NOT Model Architecture
oversight_to_ceo_20260216_033046.body:
STOP working on model comparisons (LightGBM, CatBoost). Those are PREMATURE.

REASON: We need 100K+ observations for deep learning. Currently we have:
- 35K hourly BTC samples (1 asset)
- Need: 500K+ samples across multiple assets

MODEL ARCHITECTURE EXPERIMENTS ARE BLOCKED until we have:
1. Cross-asset hourly data (ETH, SOL, AVAX, DOT, LINK, ADA, MATIC)
2. On-chain features (MVRV, NVT, NUPL, SOPR)
3. Macro features (DXY, Gold, SPX, VIX)

REVISED PRIORITY ORDER:
1. [CRITICAL] holdout-1h — Quick validation (2 min), do this first
2. [CRITICAL] data-crossasset — Fetch hourly data for 7 altcoins (this is 7x more data!)
3. [HIGH] features-onchain — MVRV, NVT, NUPL, SOPR for BTC + all assets
4. [HIGH] features-macro — DXY, Gold, SPX, VIX correlation features
5. [MEDIUM] signal-aggregation — Build 1h->daily pipeline
6. [BLOCKED] model-lightgbm — WAIT until cross-asset data is ready
7. [BLOCKED] model-catboost — WAIT until cross-asset data is ready
8. [BLOCKED] walkforward-1h — WAIT until more data
9. [BLOCKED] multiseed-1h — WAIT until more data
10. [BLOCKED] feature-selection — WAIT until all features are built

USE SUB-AGENTS (sonnet model) TO PARALLELIZE DATA COLLECTION:
- Sub-agent 1: Fetch ETH hourly data
- Sub-agent 2: Fetch SOL+AVAX+DOT hourly data
- Sub-agent 3: Fetch LINK+ADA+MATIC hourly data
- Sub-agent 4: Fetch on-chain metrics (Glassnode/CryptoQuant APIs)
- Sub-agent 5: Fetch macro data (FRED API for DXY, Yahoo Finance for Gold/SPX/VIX)
- YOU: Run holdout-1h, then build feature engineering pipeline for cross-asset

Each sub-agent writes to separate data files — ZERO conflicts. Run them ALL at once.
